theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on telomere shortening triggering DNA damage response and p53-p21 pathway leading to replicative senescence.
Emphasizes telomere shortening and DNA damage response as primary triggers of senescence and SASP.
Describes replicative senescence triggered by telomere shortening and stress-induced senescence with SASP involvement.
Links replicative senescence via telomere shortening to aging and Alzheimer's disease with SASP and DNA damage response.
Highlights irreversible growth arrest from telomere shortening and DNA damage, SASP secretion, and aging/disease causality.
Focuses on replicative senescence, telomere uncapping, DNA damage response, and SASP driving aging phenotypes.
Describes senescence triggered by telomere shortening and stressors, with SASP promoting tissue inflammation and aging.
IGFBP-5 induces senescence via p53 activation linked to DNA damage signaling, fitting telomere/DNA damage-driven senescence.
Focuses on DNA damage from ionizing radiation triggering DDR, p53-p21 and p16-Rb pathways, and SASP leading to senescence.
Describes senescence induced by DNA damage, telomere dysfunction, oxidative stress, with DDR and metabolic reprogramming.
Highlights senescence driven by stress/damage, SASP secretion, and p16INK4a as biomarker of biological aging.
Focuses on senescence as tumor suppression via heterochromatin formation triggered by DNA damage and stress.
Emphasizes epigenetic regulation of senescence induced by DNA damage, telomere shortening, and oncogene activation.
Describes replicative senescence and tumor suppression via p53 and pRb pathways activated by DNA damage and stress.
Focuses on epigenetic regulation of INK4-ARF locus controlling p16INK4a and p15INK4b expression during senescence.
Describes DBC1 regulation of senescence onset via HDAC3 inhibition affecting DNA damage response and p16Ink4a expression.
Senescence induced by DNA damage, telomere shortening, mitochondrial dysfunction with SASP driving inflammation and disease.
Senescence as tumor suppressor response to DNA damage, telomere erosion, oncogene activation, mediated by p53 and pRb.
Focuses on autophagy decline impairing immune cell function and promoting immunosenescence, with spermidine and TFEB roles.
Describes T cell replicative exhaustion, thymic involution, and accumulation of senescent CD28-negative T cells in aging immunity.
Senescence induced by multiple stressors including mitochondrial dysfunction and oxidative stress, contributing to cardiovascular aging.
Senescence in skin linked to mTORC1 and lysosomal function, highlighting autophagy-related pathways in aging and inflammageing.
Focuses on tropoelastin and ECM regulation delaying replicative senescence and modulating SASP in mesenchymal stromal cells.
Describes extracellular vesicles released by senescent cells propagating senescence signals and SASP, affecting tissue microenvironment.
p53-mediated mitophagy in aged adipocytes affects mitochondrial content and adipocyte function, linking metabolism and senescence.
Senolytic interventions targeting senescent cells in neurodegeneration, emphasizing SASP and systemic effects of senescence.
